abstract.t: The secure anycast tunneling protocol (SATP) defines a protocol used for communication between any combination of unicast and anycast tunnel endpoints. It allows tunneling of every ETHER TYPE protocol (ethernet, ip ...). SATP directly includes cryptography and message authentication based on the methodes used by SRTP. It can be used as an encrypted alternative to IP Encapsulation within IP [3] and Generic Routing Encapsulation (GRE) [4]. It supports both anycast receivers and senders.
